snippet: Businesses weighed next moves after a deal that allows merchants to offer discounts to those paying with cash, and to impose fees on those using plastic.
abstract: Businesses weigh next moves after a deal with Visa and MasterCard that allows merchants to offer discounts to customers paying with cash, and to impose fees when they pay with credit cards; businesses can also negotiate directly over the rates they pay for credit card transactions; there is little consensus about how things will settle out.

byline.original: By STEPHANIE CLIFFORD and STEPHANIE STROM
byline.contributor: Glenn Collins and Ann Carrns contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Businesses weighed next moves after a deal that allows merchants to offer discounts to those paying with cash, and to impose fees on those using plastic.

headline.seo: Merchants Consider Credit Card Surcharges or Cash Discounts
